intro: Ouratea stenorrhachis, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by round, fleshy fruits. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
